The reason why windows drives can be mounted on a Linux(or other) system and allow direct access to files is because NTFS is not encrypted by default.

Understanding UAC (Documentation):User Account Control is a protection mechanism that simply disallows/disarms automated installation of malicious(any) software on the system. If an application is being installed on the system, a standard user is presented with a credential prompt while an administrative user is presented with a consent prompt for authorization. When granted, high integrity(administrative level) token is issued to the process.

ADS(Alternate Data Streams) in NTFS:A file can have multiple streams. And threat actors used to exploit this feature by hiding their malware/malicious code by creating another stream in the same file and putting the malware there. Windows doesn't list streams associated with a file by default, and that is why this method worked. However, it is discontinued now.

**Difference between ``lsadump::lsa /patch`` and ``lsadump::lsa /inject`` in mimikatz.**So basically, ``/patch`` - as the name suggests patches internal sys/func calls to bypass validation checks while ``/inject`` creates another thread inside(in the context of) ``lsass.exe`` process to dump credentials.

A great talk on domain enumeration and attacking active directory from non-windows environments. Since AD consists of mostly open protocols(Kerberos, LDAP etc), we don't actually need windows based environments and tools like powershell to enumerate and attack AD. We can utilize open source tools like `ldapsearch` , `smbclient` to talk to AD components.

OSINT framework focused on gathering information from free tools or resources. The intention is to help people find free OSINT resources.
